primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of the hearer from a self-indulgent/narcissistic individual into a 'truly human' adult who practices economic justice and neighborly love.

tekstueel_bewijs: followers are to give themselves over
the adulthood of the gospel toward which we grow
the notion of being truly human

zender.identificatie: The Biblical Text / The Poet / Jesus (as Teacher)

ontvanger.identificatie: The Neighborhood / The Community / The Poor
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is the Subject who must perform, not the Receiver of a gift.

helper.identificatie: The Eucharist (The Meal) / The Mind of Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: we have the mind of Christ
a meal for the truly human toward which we grow
helper.rol_van_god: God is largely the Model or the Goal, rather than the active Subject/Helper.

tegenstander.identificatie: Narcissism / Self-indulgence / Society's definition of success
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is framed as a lack of maturity or a social conditioning rather than a cosmic power or ontological death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: There is no distinct Soteriological program where God acts upon the human condition independently of human effort.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: N/A
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'Gospel' is equated with the 'Ethical Program' itself.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the fast that I choose [says God]

voorbeelden: followers are to give themselves over
let me tell you about real religious discipline

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes that by 'knowing' (Savoir) what a true adult looks like, the hearer 'must' (Devoir) and therefore 'can' (assumed Pouvoir) achieve it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From Niet-S2 (Moralism) to S1 (True Humanity), bypassing S2 (Judgment) entirely.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in human growth and 'sloughing off' bad habits.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Low. The 'wicked' simply 'melt away' and their desire comes to nothing; there is no divine judgment or wrath addressed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the word 'Gospel,' the sermon functions as a call to ethical self-improvement. God is a model to imitate, not a Savior who intervenes.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Be more like the God of mercy... Be like that!
the freedom of God to override petty promoting of self

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: That is why we eat and drink here

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The 'Righteous Person' of Psalm 112 and the 'Adult' of the Gospel are presented as archetypes for the hearer to inhabit.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The Heavenly Father (as model for perfection)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the only truly human one who fulfills the fast of Isaiah 58 on behalf of the failed neighbor.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration followed by exhaustion; the bar is raised to 'perfection' without providing the 'pouvoir' (power).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Pelagianism; the human will is the engine of sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is logically consistent in its call to social justice, but theologically incoherent regarding the role of Christ's atonement.
spanning_punten: The 'Gospel' is defined as a 'notion of being human' rather than news of what God has done.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Be more like the God of mercy... Be like that!

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer is expected to 'slough off' indifference through their own growth.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'narcissism' and 'indifference'—failings of maturity rather than a state of death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon casts the hearer as the Subject and God as the Object/Model. This creates a 'Law' structure even when discussing 'Grace'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one 'loosing the bonds' and 'sharing the bread'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God/Christ as the Subject who looses the bonds of the hearer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Before we can share our bread, Christ becomes the Bread shared with us in our spiritual hunger.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer first as the one under the 'yoke' who needs the 'fast' of God to set them free.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Mind of Christ' is a gift given, not a mindset to be achieved.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Address the 'wickedness' as a power that we cannot 'slough off' by ourselves.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, the 'Subject' (Hearer) doesn't need a Savior, only a coach.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God saves the narcissistic human (Grace). 2. The freed human serves the neighbor (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong social conscience but lacks the 'engine of grace' that makes the Christian life possible. It risks turning the Gospel into a new, heavier Law.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'adult' metaphor; Greimas reveals the hearer is burdened with the role of Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might confirm the social justice themes of Isaiah 58; semiotics shows the sermon ignores the 'Sender' (God) as the primary actor.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'God' is used as a noun/model but rarely as a transitive verb.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Liberal Moralism' where the Gospel is redefined as 'becoming a better human'.
